body:
> I recently went through the effort to add Prometheus and Grafana based monitoring to a search stack for ecommerce applications, and what made the experience really great was that there was already a wonderful Solr template and Rails template dashboards available from Grafana. Writing your own Grafana dashboard isn't for the faint of heart!
> 
> Would you be able to publish a template dashboard for Zeppelin as well? That would move this from a "hey, we _should_ monitor Zeppelin" to a "no excuses, its easy to monitor Zeppelin" ;-)
> 
> [querqy/chorus#23](https://github.com/querqy/chorus/pull/23)

Thank you very much for your feedback. I have created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-5123 to track this.

Hi, I have add the appveyor yml and the appveyor build succeeded, the CI check shows green.. (see [appveyor build](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/zeppelin/builds/36021734) )  Anything else holding this PR being merged?

@zjffdu  I'm using following JDBC config:
```
hive.driver org.apache.hive.jdbc.HiveDriver 
hive.user hive  
hive.password   
hive.proxy.user.property  hive.server2.proxy.user 
hive.url  jdbc:hive2://phivea-3.phivea.root.psk.site:2181/;serviceDiscoveryMode=zooKeeper;zooKeeperNamespace=hiveserver2;retries=5;hiveCreateAsExternalLegacy=true  
hive.splitQueries true


zeppelin.jdbc.keytab.location /var/run/cloudera-scm-agent/process/180-zeppelin-ZEPPELIN_SERVER/zeppelin.keytab
zeppelin.jdbc.principal zeppelin/phivea-1.phivea.root.hwx.site@ROOT.HWX.SITE
zeppelin.jdbc.auth.type KERBEROS
```

And it does not work, fails with:
```
Could not open client transport for any of the Server URI's in ZooKeeper: Peer indicated failure: GSS initiate failed

%jdbc(hive)
select current_user()
```

I could not make jdbc log to work, looks like there is a conflicting jar/log4j.property that gets downloaded with org.apache.hive:hive-jdbc. But here are hive-server logs:
When it does not work (with patch applied): https://pastebin.com/GZPMw26q
When it works (without patch): https://pastebin.com/6CZkxQC0

It looks like you are using ranger, not sure whether it is related. And if there's no log file, this is an issue that we should fix as well. (I remember I can produce the jdbc log file, not sure how it doesn't work for you)

Question:
Why is that commented by default?
My problem is that if I click on Helium, there is no list as it was in 0.8.2. If I put it back into the `zeppelin-site.xml` it appears, so I am wondering what's the purpose of this?

This only happens is I specify jdbc-hive (CDH) that is somehow bundlling log4j.property which is causing no logs getting generated for jdbc interpreter.

But like i said on the same cluster without this patch things work.

@jolo-dev many people use Zeppelin without direct connection to internet, and having remote helium registry enabled by default is causing delays during startup, or something like.  That's because it was disabled by default (in don't remember exact JIRA for that).

Hi @zjffdu,
I am aware of the loading issue but it causes troubles on our end.
We have Zeppelin running on ECS and whenever we redeploy, the `notebook-authorization.json` is gone.
I guess a compromise needs to be handled.
@jolo-dev What version of zeppelin do you use ? It is a bug if the notebook-authorization.json is gone.

I see, actually ConfigStorage has 2 implementation: 
* LocalConfigStorage  (store notebook-authorization.json in local filesystem)
* FileSystemConfigStorage. (store notebook-authorization.json in hadoop compatible file system)

I think you can use FileSystemConfigStorage to resolve your issue.
Well, we are not using hadoop. Is it possible to read this file from an S3 bucket?
@Reamer here: https://travis-ci.org/github/conker84/zeppelin/jobs/741334639

A quick look shows that most failures are not due to your changes.
I recommend that you migrate your Zeppelin fork to the CI platform travis-ci.com
 - [Migration-Guide for OpenSource projects](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/migrate/open-source-on-travis-ci-com/)
 - travis-ci.org will be officially closed down completely on December 31st, 2020 -> [Newsletter](https://mailchi.mp/3d439eeb1098/travis-ciorg-is-moving-to-travis-cicom)
Please rebase your branch to current apache/zeppelin master branch.

Hi this PR have never been merged.
So simple question is variable interpolation for bigquery interpreter is working or not at all ?
trying to use z.put(var,val) then use in %%bigquery block but no interpolation the string the placeholder is not replaced
Thanks

@richiesgr Yes, I don't think interpolation is working for bigquery interpreter right now. The easy way is just to make BigQuery extends `AbstractInterpreter`. so that user can enable interpolation via local properties, e.g.

```
%bigquery(interpolate=true)

...
```

https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-interpreter/src/main/java/org/apache/zeppelin/interpreter/AbstractInterpreter.java#L42

Wow. Thank @Reamer for working on this! +1

@Leemoonsoo 
Do you know the purpose of the Jenkins-Job?
Thanks @Reamer for the great work, it is really helpful for the community. Does job splitting trigger multiple github actions and make the CI faster ?

> Does job splitting trigger multiple github actions and make the CI faster ?

Yes and no. Yes, job splitting will trigger more workflows with fewer jobs, but they will not be faster.
Advantages:
 - You can restart a workflow with only a few jobs if a single job in it failed.

Disadvantage:
 - The overview of several workflow files is more difficult.

> Do you know the purpose of the Jenkins-Job?

You mean Jenkins-Job at ci-build.a.o (https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Zeppelin/job/zeppelin-pull-request/)?

The Jenkins job only runs a [travis_check.py](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/travis_check.py) script.

The script checks build status of the 'from' repository of the pullrequest. (and the pullrequest build in travis-ci.org of each 'from' repository account).

So, we can remove the Jenkins job, as well as travis_check.py script.

> > Do you know the purpose of the Jenkins-Job?
> 
> You mean Jenkins-Job at ci-build.a.o (https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Zeppelin/job/zeppelin-pull-request/)?
> 
> The Jenkins job only runs a [travis_check.py](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/travis_check.py) script.
> 
> The script checks build status of the 'from' repository of the pullrequest. (and the pullrequest build in travis-ci.org of each 'from' repository account).
> 
> So, we can remove the Jenkins job, as well as travis_check.py script.

It would be nice if you could delete the Jenkins job and a possible webhook after the merge.
LGTM， @Reamer We can merge it first so that it won't block other tickets, and we can improve it later if necessary.
You can also test in your fork. No PR is needed, just push to your branch. This will save resources of GitHub action. A pull request is always tested twice. Your branch and the pull request.

Thanks for the review @Reamer Regarding the conda vs pip, I think here pip would also install python packages in the conda env, because the pip is installed via conda as well.

Yes, that's true, but in general we should avoid using pip in a Conda environment  - [Using Pip in a Conda Environment](https://www.anaconda.com/blog/using-pip-in-a-conda-environment)

LGTM

@zjffdu 
What is the reason for this feature? What are the advantages over the current Spark interpreter?

@Reamer This is not to replace spark interpreter, but to be complementary to the current spark interpreter.  Current spark interpreter is for interactive development (run spark interactively), while this PR introduce the native approach (spark-submit) to run spark jobs via jars in non-interactive way. This is similar as livy's batch session (https://livy.apache.org/docs/latest/rest-api.html)
Closed until I find the bug

Cool!

I know it is out of scope, but just want to ask will there be a way to upload spark application jar file to a Zeppelin server (or machine/container where spark interpreter runs), from the client side?

@comma337 I think using `hive` as entity name is more proper,  `jdbc.hive` is a design issue in my opinion. When you create an interpreter `hive`, then `hive` is the new interpreter group name, not `jdbc`.

@zjffdu Thanks for the quick review.
I agree with you, `hive` is easier to use than `jdbc.hive`.
I understand that you intend to change convention.

Still documentation and web ui are using [interpreter group].[Interpreter name].
ex) https://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.9.0-preview2/setup/security/datasource_authorization.html#how-to-save-the-credential-information

I will close this PR and make another PR for documentation and web UI.
appreciate your help.
Thanks @comma337 , looking forward your next PR
